culture-medium.html.title: culture medium
culture-medium.html.description:
#  mouse precision cut tumour slices for modelling hepatocellular carcinomaEx-vivo Williams’ Medium E (Sigma-Aldrich) supplemented with 1% penicillin-streptomycin, 1% L-glutamine, 1% pyruvate, 1 x insulin transferrin-selenium X, 2% fetal bovine serum and 100 nM dexamethasone, at 37°C supplemented with 5% CO2. duration: 3 days
# Maintenance of drug metabolism and transport functions in human precision-cut liver slices during prolonged incubation for 5 days Slices were pre-incubated for 1 h at 37 °C in a 12-well plate filled with 1.3 ml of WME (Gibco, Life Technology) saturated with 80 % O2/5 % CO2 while gently shaking 90 times/min. Thereafter, they were transferred to another 12-well plate filled with 1.3 ml of three different media saturated with 80 %O2/5CO2: WME (with l-glutamine, Invitrogen, Paisly, Scotland) supplemented with 25 mM glucose and 50 mg/ml gentamycin (Invitrogen), RegeneMed® medium: WME supplemented with RegeneMed® additives (L3STA), antibiotics (L3MAB) and supplements (L3STS) in ratio 100:15.1:1:2.5 (RegeneMed®, San Diego, CA, USA) or Cellartis® Hepatocyte Maintenance Medium: WME supplemented with Cellartis® Hepatocyte Maintenance Medium Supplements (Cat. No. Y30051, Takara Bio Europe AB, Gothenburg, Sweden) and 50 mg/ml gentamycin. PCLS were incubated for 5 days with medium being refreshed daily.
Murine Precision-Cut Liver Slices as an Ex Vivo Model of Liver Biology Video in cutting chamber: Krebs-Henseleit buffer with 2 g/L glucose In a tissue culture laminar flow hood, pipette 1 mL of William's E medium containing 2.0 g/L glucose, 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 2 mM L-glutamine supplement, 100 U/mL penicillin, and 100 µg/mL streptomycin into 12 well tissue culture plates. NOTE: Other antibiotics and antifungal agents may also be added. Some studies have used additives in the tissue incubation medium (i.e., dexamethasone and insulin10), but these can interfere with cell signaling. duration: 5 days
# A Microfluidic Device for Long-Term Maintenance of Organotypic Liver Cultures Base: DMEM Supplements: 1% (v/v) penicillin-streptomycin 10% FBS 0.5 U/mL Insulin 20 ng/mL EGF 7 ng/mL Glucagon 7.5 μg/mL Hydrocortisone
# A Bioreactor Technology for Modeling Fibrosis in Human and Rodent Precision-Cut Liver Slices Williams Medium E 2% FBS 1× Insulin Transferrin-Selenium X 1% (v/v) penicillin-streptomycin L-glutamine 100nM Dexamethasone duration: 6 days
# Mouse precision-cut liver slices as an ex vivo model to study drug-induced cholestasis pre-heated (37 °C) and oxygenated (80%) Williams Medium E (1X, glutaMAX-1), which had been supplemented with 25 mM D-glucose monohydrate and 50 μg/ ml Gentamicin (denoted as WME GG).
Optimized and Simplified Technique for the Production and Culture of Precision-Cut Liver Slices Video Leica VT1000 S Add to the William's Medium E (WME), 2 mM L-glutamine supplement, 10% Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS), 100 U/mL penicillin, and 100 μg/ mL streptomycin, 10 μg/mL Gentamycin, 25 mM DGlucose solution and 15 mM HEPES solution.Fill the vibratome tank with ice-cold Krebs buffer.

hepatic-lobe-sampling.html.title: hepatic lobe sampling
hepatic-lobe-sampling.html.description:
murine liver
murine liver anatomy mouse strain: C57BL/6J age: 8-12 weeks
sex: should also be considered Cuño‑Gómiz et al., 2023 sampling part: left lateral lobe much more smaller than human liver, pathological variability limited easy to operate, left lateral lob is superficial better represetativeness: stable metabolic enzyme expression and hemodynamic characteristics cutting direction: parallel to lobule
human liver
human liver anatomy sampling part: from both lobs why?
- Corrected fibrosis staging in 21% of cases (8 of 38 patients) when left lobe sampling was added to right lobe assessment. (S. Khurana et al., 2019) - Inflammatory infiltration may be unevenly distributed across different hepatic lobes. Fibrotic patterns can exhibit regional heterogeneity, and the degree of steatosis may vary significantly among different areas of the liver. 病人样本无法选择

pcls.html.title: PCLS
pcls.html.description: Vibramote: Leica VT1000 SMethods Liver tissue was cored using a 8-mm Stiefel biopsy punch (Medisave, Weymouth, UK). Cores were transferred to a metal mould, submerged in 3% low geling temperature agarose (A9414; Sigma-Aldrich, Poole, UK), and placed on ice for 2-5 minutes. Agaroseembedded liver cores were superglued to the vibratome mounting stage, submersed in the media chamber containing 4°C Hank’s balanced salt solution+, and cut using a Leica VT1200S vibrating blade microtome (Leica Biosystems, Milton Keynes, UK) at a speed 0.3 mm/sec, amplitude 2 mm, and thickness (step size) of 250 μm (Fig. 1A). PCLSs were transferred onto 8-μm-pore Transwell inserts and cultured under static conditions in standard 12-well plates (Greiner Bio-One, Kremsmuenster, Austria) or in a modified tissue culture plate (BioR plate) and rocked on the bioreactor platform (patent PCT/GB2016/053310) at a flow rate of 18.136 μL/sec (Fig. 1B,C and Supporting Fig. S1A). For comparison, PCLS were cultured in Kirstall Quasivivo (qv500) units according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Supporting Fig. S1B). All PCLSs were cultured in Williams medium E (W4128; SigmaAldrich), supplemented with 1% penicillin/streptomycin and l-glutamine, 1× insulin transferrin-selenium X, and 2% fetal bovine serum (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Cramlington, UK), and 100 nM of dexamethasome (Cerilliant, Texas, USA) at 37°C, supplemented with 5% CO2. Media were changed daily.

pre-think.html.title: Pre-Think
pre-think.html.description:
The maximum duration for which PCLS can maintain functional viability under in vitro culture conditions, (ideally up to two weeks).
Standardization of mouse strain selection and hepatic lobe sampling to improve the reproducibility of PCLS preparation.
Identification of viability and activity markers for PCLS beyond cleaved caspase 3.
Exploration of methodologies other than IHC and WB for assessing tissue viability and functional integrity.
Systematic benchmarking against the existing PCLS literature, including a consolidated summary of culture medium composition and critical operational parameters.
Establishment of a PCLS based experimental platform for MASH research, including the construction of a dedicated in vitro experimental unit and the overall experimental setup.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
